report.title: Poem
report.author: gus
report.bodytext: Like curtains of raindrops falling down /n Each glittering jewel a twinkling sound /n your love sweeps upon me /n within me /n without /n A breath of deadly beauty /n And conciousness therein /n You glitter and shine /n And turn inside out /n these selves that are calling my soul to come out /n A sweet breath is blowing my soul into fire /n My body is dying so that I might go higher /n Into the void I now burst anew /n The celestial creatures a blessing bestow /n On my selfless dying and comedy show /n The same experience a friend once had /n to wander through the heavens /n to experience the riddle of the universe /n to remember what you forgot /n to know who you are /n to know you've come so far /n to know your soul's evolution is infinite /n to be ordered to say your piece of the puzzle /n that is the fathomless mystery /n that is the universe within us /n to feel divine love ravage our body /n and turn every cell inside out /n to feel your bones ache /n and know that one day your body will die /n to know what will be left behind /n to go beyond the door /n that is guarded by the image of our self /n to sacrifice this image so we may be born anew /n well my friend said he did not know what to do /n when he came back and had to talk to me and you /n but he was very humble that friend of mine /n who had sacrificed his body /n to witness the mysteries of time /n just imagine /n just imagine being a limitless being /n constantly imaging itself /n constantly getting to know itself /n constantly making love to itself /n constantly suprised /n and constantly being alarmed by itself /n constantly enchanted by itself /n constantly dying and constantly being born /n constantly mended and constantly torn /n constantly crying /n and constantly laughing at us /n the myriad lifeforms that inhabit it /n that are it /n that are its eyes and ears /n And after all this I hear an angel's astonished shout /n does it really fucking matter /n who we think we are /n does it really fucking matter if the Jones have a bigger car /n does it really fucking matter /n if someone beats you up /n does it really fucking matter /n if you live in a rubbish bin /n when such truly timeless beauty /n can be found within
